alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coshocton; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 7:12PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN COSHOCTON... NORTHWESTERN CARROLL AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sugarcreek, or 8 miles southwest of Dover, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Newcomerstown, Minerva, Strasburg, Sugarcreek, Malvern, Bolivar, Baltic, Midvale, Mineral City, and Barnhill. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 67 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
